data.title: Timeline: Britney Spears' life of ups and downs
data.meta_description: It's hard to believe that Britney Spears launched her music career more than a decade ago. Between the marriages, children, mental breakdowns and visits to rehab, it's hard to remember when she was fâ€¦
data.text:
It's hard to believe that Britney Spears launched her music career more than a decade ago. Between the marriages, children, mental breakdowns and visits to rehab, it's hard to remember when she was famous for making music and not for being crazy. Spears will be at Jacksonville Veterans Memorial Arena on Saturday. Here is a timeline of the notable highs and lows of her career.

1981 Britney Jean Spears is born Dec. 2 in McComb, Miss.

1986 Makes her singing debut at her kindergarten graduation. She performs the song "What Child Is This?"

1990 First auditions for "The Mickey Mouse Club" at age 8 but is rejected for being too young.

1991 Becomes an understudy for the lead role of Tina Denmarck in the off-Broadway production of "Ruthless!"

1992 Makes her first appearance on "Star Search" at age 10. She wins the first round of competition but loses the second.

1993 Auditions for "The Mickey Mouse Club" again and is accepted at age 11. Co-stars include Justin Timberlake, Keri Russell and Christina Aguilera.

1994 "The Mickey Mouse Club" is canceled. Spears moves back home to Kentwood, La.

1998 Is signed to Jive Records and records her debut album, "Hit Me Baby One More Time," in Sweden.

1999 Goes out on her first real concert tour, where she opens for 'N Sync.

Jan. 12, 1999 Lead single, "... Baby One More Time," debuts at No. 1 on the Billboard 200.

April 1999 Poses for her first major magazine, Rolling Stone.

1999 Appears on ABC's sitcom "Sabrina, the Teenage Witch," playing herself.

May 13, 2000 Hosts and performs on "Saturday Night Live."

May 16, 2000 Releases her sophomore album, "Oops! ... I Did it Again." The album sells more than 20 million copies worldwide.

Sept. 7, 2000 Confesses to dating 'N Sync frontman Timberlake.

Feb. 2001 Signs a two-year contract with Pepsi.

Sept. 6, 2001 Performs "Slave 4 U" at the MTV Video Music Awards with a large albino python.

Nov. 6, 2001 Releases third album, "Britney."

Feb. 2, 2002 Hosts and performs on "Saturday Night Live" for a second time.

Feb. 11, 2002 Releases her film "Crossroads."

July 1, 2002 Ends four-year relationship with Timberlake.

Aug. 29, 2003 Kisses Madonna during their performance of "Like a Virgin" at the MTV Video Awards.

Nov. 17, 2003 Receives a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

Nov. 18, 2003 Releases fourth album, "In the Zone."

Jan. 3, 2004 Marries childhood friend Jason Allen Alexander at The Little White Wedding Chapel in Las Vegas. The marriage is annulled 55 hours later.

March 26, 2004 Brings her "Onyx Hotel Tour" to Jacksonville Veterans Memorial Arena.

September 2004 Releases her first fragrance, "Curious."

Sept. 18, 2004Marries dancer Kevin Federline.

Oct. 7, 2004 Fires longtime manager Larry Rudolph.

Nov. 9, 2004 Releases greatest hits collection, "Greatest Hits My Prerogative."

Feb. 25, 2005 Banned from the Oscars - along with Paris Hilton and Pamela Anderson - because the committee didn't want the awards ceremony to become a sideshow.

April 12, 2005 Confirms she's pregnant with her first child.

May 17, 2005 Her TV reality show with her husband, "Chaotic," airs on the UPN network.

May 21, 2005 Pregnant Spears vomits in the swimming pool of a hotel.

June 6, 2005 Hilton declares she would make a better mom than Spears.

June 13, 2005 Security software company Panda Software announces Spears as the No. 1 Virus Celebrity.

Sept. 14, 2005 Gives birth to son Sean Preston Federline.

Feb. 6, 2006 Photos surface of Spears driving with her son on her lap.

April 1, 2006 Sean Preston falls out of his high chair at home. Spears is questioned by the Los Angeles Department of Children and Family Services.

May 9, 2006 Appears on "Late Show with David Letterman" to announce she's pregnant with second child.

2006 Guest stars on TV's "Will & Grace," where she plays a closeted lesbian.

Sept. 12, 2006 Gives birth to second son, Jayden James Federline.

Nov. 7, 2006 Files for divorce from Federline.

Feb. 14, 2007 Checks into a rehab facility, only to check out the next day.

Feb. 16, 2007 Shaves off all her hair at an LA salon.

March 2007 Reaches settlement with Federline on divorce.

July 30, 2007 Divorce is made official.

Sept. 9, 2007 Performs a disappointing version of "Gimme More" at the MTV Video Music Awards.

October 2007 Loses physical custody of her kids to Federline.

October 2007 Releases her fifth studio album, "Blackout."

January 2008 Visitation rights with her children are suspended after an encounter with police.

January 2008 Committed to the psychiatric ward of Ronald Reagan UCLA Medical Center and put on an involuntary psychiatric hold.

Feb. 6, 2008 Released from psych ward.

February 2008 Regains some visitation rights with her children. Those rights increase over the next few years.

March 2008 Makes a guest appearance on TV's "How I Met Your Mother." Episode earns the show its highest ratings ever.

Sept. 7, 2008 Does not perform, but wins "Best Female Video," "Best Pop Video," and "Video of the Year" for "Pieces of Me" at the MTV Video Music Awards.

Sept. 26, 2008 Lead single "Womanizer," becomes Spears' first No. 1 in the Billboard Hot 100 since "... Baby One More Time."

Dec. 2, 2008 Releases her sixth studio album, "Circus."

2008 Sets a record in the "Guinness Book of World Records" as the youngest female artist to have five albums debut at No. 1.

March 3, 2009 Embarks on the "Circus Tour," which rakes in $131.8 million.

May 2009 Confirms she is dating her agent, Jason Trawick. He later quits being her manager to focus on their relationship.

Sept. 28, 2010 TV's "Glee" dedicates an episode to her. She makes a guest appearance as herself.

March 25, 2011 Releases her seventh studio album, "Femme Fatale."

May 2011 "Till The World Ends," her second single, reaches No. 3 on the Billboard Hot 100.

June 16, 2011 Spears' "Femme Fatale Tour" opens in Sacramento.

Rachel Tannenbaum: (904) 359-4693
